page.title: 06Recreation
page.content: Hampshire is noted for its game shooting and there are several flourishing "shoots" in the study area This is mainly pheasant shooting and large numbers of these birds are reared for restocking. Stocks of wild game birds both pheasant and partridge have declined greatly since the widespread use of pesticides. Wild and feral deer are numerous in the area. The roe are truly wild and have colon- ised the area in the last 15-20 years. Some wild fallow deer have always been present but their numbers have been greatly increased by escapes from private deer parks.Regular culling of both species is necessary to avoid unacceptable damage to forestry and agriculture. This is now done with rifles, the barbarous use of shotguns and snares being largely prohibited.
